classdef.name: ScriptUI
classdef.shortdesc: A global class containing central information about ScriptUI. Not instantiable.

property.name: applicationFonts
property.shortdesc: The font constants defined by the host application.

property.name: compatibility
property.shortdesc: An object whose properties are the names of compatability modes supported by the host application.
property.description: The presence of ScriptUI.compatability.su1PanelCoordinates means that the application allows backward compatibility with the coordinate system of Panel elements in ScriptUI version 1.

property.name: coreVersion
property.shortdesc: A string containing the internal version number of the ScriptUI module.

property.name: environment
property.shortdesc: An object whose properties define attributes of the environment in which ScriptUI operates.

property.name: events
property.shortdesc: An object whose properties and methods provide access to objects used in the ScriptUI event system.
property.description: It contains one function, createEvent(), which allows you to create event objects in order to simulate user-interaction event

property.name: frameworkName
property.shortdesc: A string containing the name of the UI component framework with which this version of ScriptUI is compatible.

property.name: version
property.shortdesc: A string containing the version number of the ScriptUI component framework

property.name: Alignment
property.shortdesc: Collects the enumerated values that can be used in the alignment and alignChildren properties of controls and containers.
property.description: Predefined alignment values are: TOP, BOTTOM, LEFT, RIGHT, FILL, CENTER

property.name: FontStyle
property.shortdesc: Collects the enumerated values that can be used as the style argument to the ScriptUI.newFont() method.
property.description: Predefined styles are REGULAR, BOLD, ITALIC, BOLDITALIC.

method.name: getResourceText
method.shortdesc: Finds and returns the resource for a given text string from the host application's resource data.
method.description: If no string resource matches the given text, the text itself is returned.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The text to match.

method.name: newImage
method.shortdesc: Loads a new image from resources or disk files into an image object.
method.description: Creates a new global image object for use in controls that can display images, loading the associated images from the specified resources or image files.

parameter.name: normal
parameter.shortdesc: The resource name or the disk file path to the image used for the normal state.

parameter.name: disabled
parameter.shortdesc: The resource name, or the disk file path to the image used for the disabled state.

parameter.name: pressed
parameter.shortdesc: The resource name, or the file-system path to the image used for the pressed state.

parameter.name: rollover
parameter.shortdesc: The resource name, or the file-system path to the image used for the rollover state.

method.name: newFont
method.shortdesc: Creates a new font object for use in text controls and titles.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The font name, or the font family name.

parameter.name: style
parameter.shortdesc: The font style; can be string, or one of the values of ScriptUI.FontStyle.

parameter.name: size
parameter.shortdesc: The font size in points.

classdef.name: Window
classdef.shortdesc: The instance represents a top-level window or dialog box, which contains user-interface elements.
classdef.description: The globally available Window object provides access to predefined and script-defined windows.

method.name: Window
method.shortdesc: Creates a new window.

parameter.name: type
parameter.shortdesc: The window type.
parameter.description:
One of:
window: Creates a simple window that can be used as a main window for an application. (Not supported by Photoshop CS3.)
palette: Creates a modeless dialog, also called a floating palette. (Not supported by Photoshop CS3.)
dialog: Creates a modal dialog.
This argument can also be a ScriptUI resource specification; in that case, all other arguments are ignored.

parameter.name: title
parameter.shortdesc: The window title, a localizable string.

parameter.name: bounds
parameter.shortdesc: The window's position and size.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.shortdesc: An object containing creation-only properties.
parameter.description:
Can contain any of these properties:
resizeable: When true, the window can be resized by the user. Default is false.
su1PanelCoordinates: Photoshop only. When true, the child panels of this window automatically adjust the positions of their children for compatability with Photoshop CS (in which the vertical coordinate was measured from outside the frame). Default is false. Individual panels can override the parent window’s setting.
closeButton: When true, the title bar includes a button to close the window, if the platform and window type allow it. When false, it does not. Default is true. Not used for dialogs.
maximizeButton: When true, the title bar includes a button to expand the window to its maximum size (typically, the entire screen), if the platform and window type allow it. When false, it does not. Default is false for type palette, true for type window. Not used for dialogs.
minimizeButton: When true, the title bar includes a button to minimize or iconify the window, if the platform and window type allow it. When false, it does not. Default is false for type palette, true for type window. Main windows cannot have a minimize button in Mac OS. Not used for dialogs.
independent: When true, a window of type window is independent of other application windows, and can be hidden behind them in Windows. In Mac OS, has no effect. Default is false.
borderless: When true, the window has no title bar or borders. Properties that control those features are ignored.

property.name: frameworkName
property.shortdesc: Deprecated. Use ScriptUI.frameworkName instead.

property.name: version
property.shortdesc: Deprecated. Use ScriptUI.version instead.

method.name: find
method.shortdesc: Use this method to find an existing window.
method.description: This includes windows defined by ScriptUI resource strings, windows already created by a script, and windows created by the application (if the application supports this case). This function is not supported by all applications. Returns a Window object found or generated from the resource, or null if no such window or resource exists.

parameter.name: type
parameter.shortdesc: The name of a predefined resource available to JavaScript in the current application; or the window type.
parameter.description: If a title is specified, the type is used if more than one window with that title is found. Can be null or the empty string.

parameter.name: title
parameter.shortdesc: The window title.

method.name: alert
method.shortdesc: Displays a platform-standard dialog containing a short message and an OK button.

parameter.name: message
parameter.shortdesc: TThe string for the displayed message.

parameter.name: title
parameter.shortdesc: A string to appear as the title of the dialog, if the platform supports a title.
parameter.description: Ignored in Mac OS, which does not support titles for alert dialogs. The default title string is "Script Alert".

parameter.name: errorIcon
parameter.shortdesc: When true, the platform-standard alert icon is replaced by the platform-standard error icon in the dialog.
parameter.description: Ignored in Mac OS, which does not support icons for alert dialogs.

method.name: confirm
method.shortdesc: Displays a platform-standard dialog containing a short message and two buttons labeled Yes and No.
method.description: Returns true if the user clicked Yes, false if the user clicked No.

parameter.name: message
parameter.shortdesc: The string for the displayed message.

parameter.name: noAsDefault
parameter.shortdesc: When true, the No button is the default choice, selected when the user types Enter.
parameter.description: Default is false, meaning that Yes is the default choice.

parameter.name: title
parameter.shortdesc: A string to appear as the title of the dialog, if the platform supports a title.
parameter.description: Ignored in Mac OS, which does not support titles for alert dialogs. The default title string is "Script Alert".

method.name: prompt
method.shortdesc: Displays a modal dialog that returns the user’s text input.
method.description: Returns the value of the text edit field if the user clicked OK, null if the user clicked Cancel.

parameter.name: prompt
parameter.shortdesc: The string for the displayed message.

parameter.name: default
parameter.shortdesc: The initial value to be displayed in the text edit field.

parameter.name: title
parameter.shortdesc: A string to appear as the title of the dialog.
parameter.description: In Windows, this appears in the window’s frame; in Mac OS it appears above the message. The default title string is "Script Prompt".

property.name: graphics
property.shortdesc: The graphics object that can be used to customize the window’s appearance, in response to the onDraw event.

property.name: visible
property.shortdesc: When true, the element is shown, when false it is hidden.
property.description: When a container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but they retain their own visibility values, and are shown or hidden accordingly when the parent is next shown.

property.name: bounds
property.shortdesc: The bounds of the window's drawable area, excluding the frame, in screen coordinates.

property.name: frameBounds
property.shortdesc: The bounds of the window frame in screen coordinates.
property.description: The frame consists of the title bar and borders that enclose the content region of a window, depending on the windowing system.

property.name: frameLocation
property.shortdesc: The top left corner of the window frame in screen coordinates.
property.description: The same as [frameBounds.x, frameBounds.y]. Set this value to move the window frame to the specified location on the screen. The frameBounds value changes accordingly.

property.name: frameSize
property.shortdesc: The size and location of the window's frame in screen coordinates.

property.name: location
property.shortdesc: The upper left corner of the window's drawable area.
property.description: The same as [bounds.x, bounds.y].

property.name: maximumSize
property.shortdesc: The largest rectangle to which the window can be resized.

property.name: minimumSize
property.shortdesc: The smallest rectangle to which the window can be resized.

property.name: preferredSize
property.shortdesc: The preferred size of the window.
property.description: Used in automatic layout and resizing. To set a specific value for only one dimension, specify the other dimension as -1.

property.name: size
property.shortdesc: The current size and location of the content area of the window in screen coordinates.

property.name: windowBounds
property.shortdesc: The bounds of this window relative to the top-level parent window.

property.name: characters
property.shortdesc: A number of characters for which to reserve space when calculating the preferred size of the window.

property.name: justify
property.shortdesc: The default text justification style for child text elements.
property.description: One of left, center, or right. Justification only works if this value is set on creation of the element.

property.name: text
property.shortdesc: The title, label, or displayed text, a localizeable string.
property.description: Does not apply to containers of type group.

property.name: active
property.shortdesc: Set to true to make this window active.

description.li: A modal dialog that is visible is by definition the active dialog.
An active palette is the front-most window.
An active control is the one with focus—that is, the one that accepts keystrokes, or in the case of a Button, be selected when the user types Return or Enter.

property.name: shortcutKey
property.shortdesc: The keypress combination that invokes this element's onShortcutKey() callback.

property.name: cancelElement
property.shortdesc: For windows of type dialog, the UI element to notify when the user presses a cancellation key combination.
property.description: The cancellation key is the Esc key. By default, looks for a button whose name or text is "cancel" (case disregarded).

property.name: defaultElement
property.shortdesc: For windows of type dialog, the UI element to notify when the user presses a Enter key.
property.description: By default, looks for a button whose name or text is "ok" (case disregarded).

property.name: maximized
property.shortdesc: True if the window is expanded.

property.name: minimized
property.shortdesc: True if the window is minimized or iconified.

property.name: alignChildren
property.shortdesc: Tells the layout manager how unlike-sized children of this container should be aligned within a column or row.
property.description: Order of creation determines which children are at the top of a column or the left of a row; the earlier a child is created, the closer it is to the top or left of its column or row. If defined, alignment for a child element overrides the alignChildren setting for the parent container. See alignment property for values.

property.name: children
property.shortdesc: The collection of UI elements that have been added to this container.
property.description: An array indexed by number or by a string containing an element's name. The length property of this array is the number of child elements for container elements, and is zero for controls.

property.name: layout
property.shortdesc: The layout manager for this container.
property.description: The first time a container object is made visible, ScriptUI invokes this layout manager by calling its layout() function. Default is an instance of the LayoutManager class that is automatically created when the container element is created.

property.name: margins
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels between the edges of a container and the outermost child elements.
property.description: You can specify different margins for each edge of the container. The default value is based on the type of container, and is chosen to match the standard Adobe UI guidelines.

property.name: orientation
property.shortdesc: The layout orientation of children in a container.
property.description: Interpreted by the layout manager for the container. The default LayoutManager Object accepts the (case-insensitive) values row, column, or stack. For window and panel, the default is column, and for group the default is row. The allowed values for the container’s alignChildren and its children’s alignment properties depend on the orientation.

property.name: spacing
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels separating one child element from its adjacent sibling element.
property.description: Because each container holds only a single row or column of children, only a single spacing value is needed for a container. The default value is based on the type of container, and is chosen to match standard Adobe UI guidelines.

property.name: alignment
property.shortdesc: The alignment style for child elements of a container. If defined, this value overrides the alignChildren setting for the parent container.
property.description:
This can be a single string, which indicates the alignment for the orientation specified in the parent container, or an array of two strings, indicating both the horizontal and vertical alignment (in that order). Allowed values depend on the orientation value of the parent container. They are not case sensitive.
For orientation=row:top, bottom, fill
For orientation=column: left, right, fill
For orientation=stack:top, bottom, left, right, fill

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the container (properties used only when the element is created).
property.description:
Creation properties of a Window object can include:
resizeable: When true, the window can be resized by the user. Default is false.
su1PanelCoordinates: Photoshop only. When true, the child panels of this window automatically adjust the positions of their children for compatability with Photoshop CS (in which the vertical coordinate was measured from outside the frame). Default is false. Individual panels can override the parent window’s setting.
closeButton: Bridge only. When true, the title bar includes a button to close the window, if the platform and window type allow it. When false, it does not. Default is true. Not used for dialogs.
maximizeButton: Bridge only. When true, the title bar includes a button to expand the window to its maximum size (typically, the entire screen), if the platform and window type allow it. When false, it does not. Default is false for type palette, true for type window. Not used for dialogs.

property.name: enabled
property.shortdesc: True if this element is enabled.
property.description: An enabled element can accept input, according to its type. When false, control elements do not accept input, and all types of elements have a dimmed appearance.

property.name: helpTip
property.shortdesc: The help text that is displayed when the mouse hovers over the element.

property.name: indent
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels to indent the element.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The immediate parent element.

property.name: window
property.shortdesc: The window that this element belongs to.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The element type; "dialog", "palette", or "window".

property.name: opacity
property.shortdesc: The opacity of the window, in the range [0..1].
property.description: A value of 1.0 (the default) makes the window completely opaque, a value of 0 makes it completely transparent. Intermediate values make it partially transparent to any degree.

method.name: show
method.shortdesc: Makes this window visible.
method.description:
If an onShow() callback is defined for a window, calls that function before showing the window.When a window or container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but when it is shown again, the children retain their own visibility states.
For a modal dialog, opens the dialog and does not return until the dialog is dismissed. If it is dismissed via the close() method, this method returns any result value passed to that method. Otherwise, returns 0.

method.name: hide
method.shortdesc: Hides this windows.
method.description:
When a window is hidden, its children are also hidden, but when it is shown again, the children retain their own visibility states.
For a modal dialog, closes the dialog and sets its result to 0.

method.name: notify
method.shortdesc: Sends a notification message to all listeners, simulating the specified user interaction event.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The event name; if omitted, the default event is sent.
parameter.description: One of: onClose, onMove, onMoving, onResize, onResizing, onShow

method.name: center
method.shortdesc: Centers this window on screen or with repect to another window.

parameter.name: window
parameter.shortdesc: The relative window. If not specified, centers on the screen.

method.name: close
method.shortdesc: Closes this window.
method.description: . If an onClose() callback is defined for the window, calls that function before closing the window.

parameter.name: return
parameter.shortdesc: A number to be returned from the show() method that invoked this window as a modal dialog.

method.name: add
method.shortdesc: Creates and returns a new control or container object and adds it to the children of this window.

parameter.name: type
parameter.shortdesc: The type of the child element, as specified for the type property.
parameter.description: Control types are listed in the JavaScript Tools Guide.

parameter.name: bounds
parameter.shortdesc: A bounds specification that describes the size and position of the new control or container, relative to its parent.
parameter.description: If supplied, this value creates a new Bounds object which is assigned to the new object’s bounds property.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The text or label, a localizable string.
parameter.description: Initial text to be displayed in the control as the title, label, or contents, depending on the control type. If supplied, this value is assigned to the new object’s text property.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the new child (properties used only when the element is created).
parameter.description:
The creation properties depend on the element type. See
properties property of each control type.

method.name: remove
method.shortdesc: Removes the specified child control from this window’s children array.
method.description: No error results if the child does not exist.

parameter.name: what
parameter.shortdesc: The child control to remove, specified by 0-based index, text property value, or as a control object.

method.name: addEventListener
method.shortdesc: Registers an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this window.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the event.
parameter.description: Predefined event names are: change, changing, move, moving, resize, resizing, show , enterKey, focus, blur, keydown, keyup, mousedown, mouseup, mousemove, mouseover, mouseout, click (detail = 1 for single, 2 for double).

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.
parameter.description: This can be the name of a function defined in the extension, or a locally defined handler function to be executed when the event occurs. A handler function takes one argument, the UIEvent object.

parameter.name: capturePhase
parameter.shortdesc: When true, the handler is called only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.
parameter.description: Default is false, meaning that the handler is called in the bubbling phase if this object is an ancestor of the target, or in the at-target phase if this object is itself the target.

method.name: removeEventListener
method.shortdesc: Unregisters an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this window.
method.description: All arguments must be identical to those that were used to register the event handler.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the event.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.

parameter.name: capturePhase
parameter.shortdesc: Whether to call the handler only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.

method.name: dispatchEvent
method.shortdesc: Simulates the occurrence of an event in this target.
method.description: A script can create a UIEvent object for a specific event and pass it to this method to start the event propagation for the event.

method.name: onActivate
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the window acquires the keyboard focus.
method.description: Called when the user gives the window the keyboard focus by clicking it or otherwise making it the active window.

method.name: onDeactivate
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the window loses the keyboard focus.
method.description: Called when the user moves the keyboard focus from the previously active window to another window.

method.name: onClose
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the window is about to be closed.
method.description: Called when a request is made to close the window, either by an explicit call to the close() function or by a user action (clicking the OS-specific close icon in the title bar). The function is called before the window actually closes; it can return false to cancel the close operation.

method.name: onMove
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the window has been moved

method.name: onMoving
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the window is being moved
method.description: Called while a window in being moved, each time the position changes. A handler can monitor the move operation.

method.name: onResize
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called after the window has been resized

method.name: onResizing
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called while a window is being resized
method.description: Called while a window is being resized, each time the height or width changes. A handler can monitor the resize operation.

method.name: onShortcutKey
method.shortdesc: In Windows only, an event-handler callback function, called a shortcut-key sequence is typed that matches the shortcutKey value for this window.

method.name: onShow
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called just before the window is displayed
method.description: Called when a request is made to open the window using the show() method, before the window is made visible, but after automatic layout is complete. A handler can modify the results of the automatic layout.

classdef.name: LayoutManager
classdef.shortdesc: Controls the automatic layout behavior for a window or container.
classdef.description: The subclass AutoLayoutManager implements the default automatic layout behavior.

method.name: layout
method.shortdesc: Invokes the automatic layout behavior for the managed container.
method.description: Adjusts sizes and positions of the child elements of this window or container according to the placement and alignment property values in the parent and children. Invoked automatically the first time the window is displayed. Thereafter, the script must invoke it explicitly to change the layout in case of changes in the size or position of the parent or children.

method.name: resize
method.shortdesc: Performs a layout after a Window is resized, based on the new size.
method.description: Resizes the child elements of the managed container with a given alignment type, after the window has been resized by the user.

classdef.name: ScriptUIPen
classdef.shortdesc: A drawing pen that defines a color and line width used to stroke paths.
classdef.description: Create with ScriptUIGraphics.newPen(). Use as a value of foregroundColor properties, and pass as an argument to drawString() and strokePath() methods.

property.name: color
property.shortdesc: The pen color.
property.description: The paint color to use when the type is SOLID_COLOR. An array in the form [R, B, G, A] specifying the red, green, blue values of the color and the opacity (alpha channel) value as numbers in the range [0.0..1.0]. An opacity of 0 is fully transparent, and an opacity of 1 is fully opaque.

property.name: theme
property.shortdesc: The theme name.
property.description: The name of a color theme to use for drawing when the type is THEME_COLOR. Theme colors are defined by the host application.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The pen type, solid or theme.
property.description: One of these constants: ScriptUIGraphics.PenType.SOLID_COLOR or ScriptUIGraphics.PenType.THEME_COLOR

property.name: lineWidth
property.shortdesc: The pixel width of the drawing line.

classdef.name: ScriptUIBrush
classdef.shortdesc: A painting brush that encapsulates a color or pattern used to fill paths.
classdef.description: Create with ScriptUIGraphics.newBrush(). Use as a value of backgroundColor properties, and pass as an argument to the fillPath() method.

property.name: color
property.shortdesc: The brush color.
property.description: The paint color to use when the type is SOLID_COLOR. An array in the form [R, B, G, A] specifying the red, green, blue values of the color and the opacity (alpha channel) value as numbers in the range [0.0..1.0]. An opacity of 0 is fully transparent, and an opacity of 1 is fully opaque.

property.name: theme
property.shortdesc: The theme name.
property.description: The name of a color theme to use for drawing when the type is THEME_COLOR. Theme colors are defined by the host application.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The brush type, solid or theme.
property.description: One of these constants: ScriptUIGraphics.BrushType.SOLID_COLOR or ScriptUIGraphics.BrushType.THEME_COLOR

classdef.name: ScriptUIPath
classdef.shortdesc: A helper object that encapsulates a drawing path for a figure to be drawn into a window or control.
classdef.description: Create with the newPath(), moveto(), lineto(), rectPath(), and ellipsePath() methods. Used as value of currentPath, where it is acted upon by methods such as closePath(). Pass as optional argument to fillPath() and strokePath(), which otherwise act upon the current path.

classdef.name: ScriptUIGraphics
classdef.shortdesc: An object used to draw custom graphics, found in the graphics property of window, container, and control objects.
classdef.description: Allows a script to customize aspects of the element’s appearance, such as the color and font. Use an onDraw callback function to set these properties or call the functions.All measurements are in pixels.

property.name: BrushType
property.shortdesc: Contains the enumerated constants for the type argument of newBrush().
property.description: Type constants are: SOLID_COLOR, THEME_COLOR.

property.name: PenType
property.shortdesc: Contains the enumerated constants for the type argument of newPen().
property.description: Type constants are: SOLID_COLOR, THEME_COLOR.

property.name: backgroundColor
property.shortdesc: The background color for containers; for non-containers, the parent background color.
property.description: The paint color and style is defined in this brush object.This property is only supported for controls like dropdownlist, edittext, and listbox.

property.name: disabledBackgroundColor
property.shortdesc: The background color for containers when disabled or inactive; for non-containers, the parent background color.
property.description: The paint color and style is defined in this brush object.This property is only supported for controls like dropdownlist, edittext, and listbox.

property.name: disabledForegroundColor
property.shortdesc: The text color when the element is disabled or inactive.
property.description: The paint color and style is defined in this pen object.

property.name: font
property.shortdesc: The default font to use for displaying text.

property.name: foregroundColor
property.shortdesc: The text color.
property.description: The paint color and style is defined in this pen object.

property.name: currentPath
property.shortdesc: The current drawing path, encapsulated in a path object.

property.name: currentPoint
property.shortdesc: The current position in the current drawing path.

method.name: newBrush
method.shortdesc: Creates a new painting brush object.

parameter.name: type
parameter.shortdesc: The brush type, solid or theme.
parameter.description: One of the constants ScriptUIGraphics.BrushType.SOLID_COLOR or ScriptUIGraphics.BrushType.THEME_COLOR.

parameter.name: color
parameter.shortdesc: The brush color.

description.li: If type is SOLID_COLOR, the color expressed as an array of three or four values, in the form [R, B, G, A] specifying the red, green, and blue values of the color and, optionally, the opacity (alpha channel). All values are numbers in the range [0.0..1.0]. An opacity of 0 is fully transparent, and an opacity of 1 is fully opaque.
If the type is THEME_COLOR, the name string of the theme. Theme colors are defined by the host application.

method.name: newPen
method.shortdesc: Creates a new drawing pen object.

parameter.name: type
parameter.shortdesc: The pen type, solid or theme.
parameter.description: One of the constants ScriptUIGraphics.PenType.SOLID_COLOR or ScriptUIGraphics.PenType.THEME_COLOR.

parameter.name: color
parameter.shortdesc: The pen color.

description.li: If type is SOLID_COLOR, the color expressed as an array of three or four values, in the form [R, B, G, A] specifying the red, green, and blue values of the color and, optionally, the opacity (alpha channel). All values are numbers in the range [0.0..1.0]. An opacity of 0 is fully transparent, and an opacity of 1 is fully opaque.
If the type is THEME_COLOR, the name string of the theme. Theme colors are defined by the host application.

parameter.name: width
parameter.shortdesc: The width of the pen line in pixels.
parameter.description: The line is centered around the current point. For example, if the value is 2, drawing a line from (0, 10) to (5, 10) paints the two rows of pixels directly above and below y-position 10.

method.name: newPath
method.shortdesc: Creates a new, empty path object.
method.description: Replaces any existing path in currentPath.

method.name: closePath
method.shortdesc: Closes the current path.
method.description: Defines a line from the current postion (currentPoint) to the start point of the current path (the value of currentPath).

method.name: moveTo
method.shortdesc: Adds a given point to the currentPath, and makes it the current drawing position.
method.description: Returns the Point object which is the new value of currentPoint.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: The X coordinate for the new point, relative to the origin of this element.

parameter.name: y
parameter.shortdesc: The Y coordinate for the new point, relative to the origin of this element.

method.name: lineTo
method.shortdesc: Adds a path segment to the currentPath.
method.description: The line is defined from the currentPoint to the specified destination point. Returns the Point object for the destination point, which becomes the new value of currentPoint.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: The X coordinate for the destination point, relative to the origin of this element.

parameter.name: y
parameter.shortdesc: The Y coordinate for the destination point, relative to the origin of this element.

method.name: rectPath
method.shortdesc: Defines a rectangular path in the currentPath object.
method.description:
The rectangle can be filled using fillPath() or stroked using strokePath().
Returns the Point object for the upper left corner of the rectangle, which becomes the new value of currentPoint.

parameter.name: left
parameter.shortdesc: The left coordinate relative to the origin of this element.

parameter.name: top
parameter.shortdesc: The top coordinate relative to the origin of this element.

parameter.name: width
parameter.shortdesc: The width in pixels.

parameter.name: height
parameter.shortdesc: The height in pixels.

method.name: ellipsePath
method.shortdesc: Defines an elliptical path within a given rectangular area in the currentPath object, which can be filled using fillPath() or stroked using strokePath().
method.description: Returns a Point object for the upper left corner of the area, which is the new currentPoint.

parameter.name: left
parameter.shortdesc: The left coordinate of the region, relative to the origin of this element.

parameter.name: top
parameter.shortdesc: The top coordinate of the region, relative to the origin of this element.

parameter.name: width
parameter.shortdesc: The width of the region in pixels.

parameter.name: height
parameter.shortdesc: The height of the region in pixels.

method.name: strokePath
method.shortdesc: Strokes the path segments of a path with a given drawing pen.

parameter.name: pen
parameter.shortdesc: The drawing pen that defines the color and line width.

parameter.name: path
parameter.shortdesc: The path object. Default is the currentPath.

method.name: fillPath
method.shortdesc: Fills a path using a given painting brush.

parameter.name: brush
parameter.shortdesc: The brush object that defines the fill color.

parameter.name: path
parameter.shortdesc: The path object. Default is the currentPath.

method.name: drawFocusRing
method.shortdesc: Draws a focus ring within a region of this element.

parameter.name: left
parameter.shortdesc: The left coordinate of the region.
parameter.description: Value is relative to the origin of this element.

parameter.name: top
parameter.shortdesc: The top coordinate of the region.
parameter.description: Value is relative to the origin of this element.

parameter.name: width
parameter.shortdesc: The width of the region in pixels.

parameter.name: height
parameter.shortdesc: The height of the region in pixels.

method.name: drawImage
method.shortdesc: Draws an image within a given region of the element.
method.description: Uses the version of the image that is appropriate to the element's current state.

parameter.name: image
parameter.shortdesc: The image to draw.
parameter.description: This object contains different versions of an image appropriate to various element states, such as a dimmed version for the disabled state.

parameter.name: left
parameter.shortdesc: The left coordinate of the region, relative to the origin of this element.

parameter.name: top
parameter.shortdesc: The top coordinate of the region, relative to the origin of this element.

parameter.name: width
parameter.shortdesc: The width in pixels. If provided, the image is stretched or shrunk to fit. If omitted, uses the original image width.

parameter.name: height
parameter.shortdesc: The height in pixels. If provided, the image is stretched or shrunk to fit. If omitted, uses the original image height.

method.name: drawOSControl
method.shortdesc: Draw the platform-specific control associated with this element.

method.name: drawString
method.shortdesc: Draw a string of text starting at a given point in this element, using a given drawing pen and font.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The text string.

parameter.name: pen
parameter.shortdesc: The drawing pen to use.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: The left coordinate, relative to the origin of this element.

parameter.name: y
parameter.shortdesc: The top coordinate, relative to the origin of this element.

parameter.name: font
parameter.shortdesc: The font to use. Default is the font value in this object.

method.name: measureString
method.shortdesc: Calculates the size needed to display a string using the given font.
method.description: Returns a Dimension object that contains the height and width of the string in pixels.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The text string to measure.

parameter.name: font
parameter.shortdesc: The font to use. Default is the font value in this object.

parameter.name: boundingWidth
parameter.shortdesc: The bounding width.

classdef.name: DrawState
classdef.shortdesc: Describes an input state at the time of the triggering ScriptUIGraphics.onDraw() event.
classdef.description: Contains properties that report whether the current control has the input focus, and the particular mouse button and keypress state. Passed in as argument to ScriptUIGraphics.onDraw().

property.name: mouseOver
property.shortdesc: True if the cursor is hovering over this element.

property.name: leftButtonPressed
property.shortdesc: True if the left mouse button is being pressed.

property.name: middleButtonPressed
property.shortdesc: True if the middle mouse button is being pressed.

property.name: rightButtonPressed
property.shortdesc: True if the right mouse button is being pressed.

property.name: hasFocus
property.shortdesc: True if the element has the input focus.

property.name: shiftKeyPressed
property.shortdesc: True if the Shift key is being pressed.

property.name: ctrlKeyPressed
property.shortdesc: True if the Ctrl key is being pressed.

property.name: cmdKeyPressed
property.shortdesc: True if the Command key is being pressed (in Mac OS only).

property.name: optKeyPressed
property.shortdesc: True if the Option key is being pressed (in Mac OS only).

property.name: altKeyPressed
property.shortdesc: True if the Alt key is being pressed (in Windows only).

property.name: numLockKeyPressed
property.shortdesc: True if the Num Lock key is being pressed.

property.name: capsLockKeyPressed
property.shortdesc: True if the Caps Lock key is being pressed.

classdef.name: ScriptUIFont
classdef.shortdesc: Encapsulates the qualities of a font used to draw text into a control.
classdef.description: Create with the newFont() method.Used as a value of font. Passed as an argument to drawString() and measureString().

property.name: family
property.shortdesc: The font family name.

property.name: name
property.shortdesc: The complete font name, consisting of the family and style, if specified.

property.name: size
property.shortdesc: The font point size.

property.name: style
property.shortdesc: The font style. One of the constants in ScriptUIGraphics.FontStyle.

property.name: substitute
property.shortdesc: The name of a substitution font, a fallback font to substitute for this font if the requested font family or style is not available.

classdef.name: ScriptUIImage
classdef.shortdesc: Encapsulates a set of images that can be drawn into a control.
classdef.description: Different images can reflect the current state, such as a dimmed version for a disabled control. Create with the newImage() method. Passed as an argument to drawImage().

property.name: format
property.shortdesc: The image format. One of: resource, JPEG, GIF, TIFF, PNG, or PICT (Macintosh).

property.name: name
property.shortdesc: The image name. Either the file name, or the resource name.

property.name: pathname
property.shortdesc: The full path to the file that contains the image.

property.name: size
property.shortdesc: The image size in pixels.

classdef.name: StaticText
classdef.shortdesc: A text label that the user cannot change.

property.name: characters
property.shortdesc: A number of characters for which to reserve space when calculating the preferred size of the element.

property.name: justify
property.shortdesc: The text justification style.
property.description: One of left, center, or right. Justification only works if this value is set on creation of the element.

property.name: text
property.shortdesc: The text to display, a localizable string.

property.name: active
property.shortdesc: Always false. This element cannot have input focus.
property.description: An active control is the one with keyboard focus—that is, the one that accepts keystrokes, or in the case of a Button, is selected when the user types Return or Enter in Windows, or the space bar in Mac OS.

property.name: shortcutKey
property.shortdesc: The key sequence that invokes the onShortcutKey() callback for this element (in Windows only).

property.name: graphics
property.shortdesc: The graphics object that can be used to customize the element's appearance, in response to the onDraw() event.

property.name: visible
property.shortdesc: True if this element is shown, false if it is hidden.
property.description: When a container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but they retain their own visibility values, and are shown or hidden accordingly when the parent is next shown.

property.name: bounds
property.shortdesc: The boundaries of the element, in parent-relative coordinates.
property.description: Setting an element's size or location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: location
property.shortdesc: The upper left corner of this element relative to its parent.
property.description: The location is defined as [bounds.x, bounds.y]. Setting an element's location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: maximumSize
property.shortdesc: The maximum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: minimumSize
property.shortdesc: The minimum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: preferredSize
property.shortdesc: The preferred size, used by layout managers to determine the best size for each element.
property.description: If not explicitly set by a script, value is established by the UI framework in which ScriptUI is employed, and is based on such attributes of the element as its text, font, font size, icon size, and other UI framework-specific attributes.A script can explicitly set this value before the layout manager is invoked in order to establish an element size other than the default.

property.name: size
property.shortdesc: The current dimensions of this element.
property.description: Initially undefined, and unless explicitly set by a script, it is defined by a LayoutManager . A script can explicitly set size before the layout manager is invoked to establish an element size other than the preferredSize or the default size, but this is not recommended. Defined as [bounds.width, bounds.height]. Setting an element's size changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: windowBounds
property.shortdesc: The bounds of this element relative to the top-level parent window.

property.name: alignment
property.shortdesc: The alignment style for this element. If defined, this value overrides the alignChildren setting for the parent container.
property.description:
This can be a single string, which indicates the alignment for the orientation specified in the parent container, or an array of two strings, indicating both the horizontal and vertical alignment (in that order). Allowed values depend on the orientation value of the parent container. They are not case sensitive.
For orientation=row:top, bottom, fill
For orientation=column: left, right, fill
For orientation=stack:top, bottom, left, right, fill

property.name: children
property.shortdesc: An array of child elements.

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the container (properties used only when the element is created).
property.description:
Creation properties of a StaticText object can include:
multiline: When false (the default), the control displays a single line of text. When true, the control displays multiple lines, in which case the text wraps within the width of the control.
scrolling: When false (the default), the displayed text cannot be scrolled. When true, the displayed text can be vertically scrolled using the Up Arrow and Down Arrow; this case implies multiline=true.

property.name: enabled
property.shortdesc: True if this element is enabled.
property.description: An enabled element can accept input, according to its type. When false, control elements do not accept input, and all types of elements have a dimmed appearance.

property.name: helpTip
property.shortdesc: The help text that is displayed when the mouse hovers over the element.

property.name: indent
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels to indent the element during automatic layout.
property.description: Applies for column orientation and left alignment, or row orientation and top alignment.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The parent element.

property.name: window
property.shortdesc: The window that this element belongs to.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The element type, "statictext".

method.name: notify
method.shortdesc: Sends a notification message, simulating the specified user interaction event.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the control event handler to call.
parameter.description: One of: onClick, onChange, onChanging. By default, simulates the onChange event for an edittext control, an onClick event for controls that support that event.

method.name: show
method.shortdesc: Shows this element.
method.description: When a window or container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but when it is shown again, the children retain their own visibility states.

method.name: hide
method.shortdesc: Hides this element.

method.name: addEventListener
method.shortdesc: Registers an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this element.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the event.
parameter.description: Event names are listed in the JavaScript Tools Guide.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.
parameter.description: This can be the name of a function defined in the extension, or a locally defined handler function to be executed when the event occurs. A handler function takes one argument, the UIEvent object.

parameter.name: capturePhase
parameter.shortdesc: When true, the handler is called only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.
parameter.description: Default is false, meaning that the handler is called in the bubbling phase if this object is an ancestor of the target, or in the at-target phase if this object is itself the target.

method.name: removeEventListener
method.shortdesc: Unregisters an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this element.
method.description: All arguments must be identical to those that were used to register the event handler.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the event.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.

parameter.name: capturePhase
parameter.shortdesc: Whether to call the handler only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.

method.name: dispatchEvent
method.shortdesc: Simulates the occurrence of an event in this target.
method.description: A script can create a UIEvent object for a specific event and pass it to this method to start the event propagation for the event.

method.name: onDraw
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the window is about to be drawn.
method.description: Allows the script to modify or control the appearance, using the control’s associated ScriptUIGraphics object. Handler takes one argument, a DrawState object.

method.name: onShortcutKey
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element's shortcutKey sequence is typed in the active window.
method.description: In Windows only.

classdef.name: Button
classdef.shortdesc: A pushbutton element containing a mouse-sensitive text string.
classdef.description: Calls the onClick() callback if the control is clicked or if its notify() method is called.

property.name: children

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the container (properties used only when the element is created).
property.description: A Button object has no creation properties, but the third argument to the add() method that creates it can be the initial text value.

property.name: enabled
property.shortdesc: True if this element is enabled.
property.description: An enabled element can accept input, according to its type. When false, control elements do not accept input, and all types of elements have a dimmed appearance.

property.name: parent

method.name: onActivate
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element acquires the keyboard focus.
method.description: Called when the user gives the control the keyboard focus by clicking it or tabbing into it.

method.name: onDeactivate
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element loses the keyboard focus.
method.description: Called when the user moves the keyboard focus from the previously active control to another control.

method.name: onDraw
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the window is about to be drawn.
method.description: Allows the script to modify or control the appearance, using the control’s associated ScriptUIGraphics object. Handler takes one argument, a DrawState object.

method.name: onClick
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element has been clicked

method.name: onShortcutKey
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element's shortcutKey sequence is typed in the active window.
method.description: In Windows only.

method.description: In Windows only.

classdef.name: EditText
classdef.shortdesc: An editable text field that the user can select and change.
classdef.description: Calls the onChange() callback if the text is changed and the user types Enter or the control loses focus, or if its notify() method is called. Calls the onChanging() callback when any change is made to the text. The textselection property contains currently selected text.

property.name: textselection
property.shortdesc: The currently selected text, or the empty string if there is no text selected.
property.description: Setting the value replaces the current text selection and modifies the value of the text property. If there is no current selection, inserts the new value into the text string at the current insertion point. The textselection value is reset to an empty string after it modifies the text value. Note that setting the textselection property before the element’s parent Window exists is an undefined operation.

property.name: characters
property.shortdesc: A number of characters for which to reserve space when calculating the preferred size of the element.

property.name: justify
property.shortdesc: The text justification style.
property.description: One of left, center, or right. Justification only works if this value is set on creation of the element.

property.name: text
property.shortdesc: The current text displayed in the field, a localizable string.

property.name: graphics
property.shortdesc: The graphics object that can be used to customize the element's appearance, in response to the onDraw() event.

property.name: visible
property.shortdesc: True if this element is shown, false if it is hidden.
property.description: When a container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but they retain their own visibility values, and are shown or hidden accordingly when the parent is next shown.

property.name: bounds
property.shortdesc: The boundaries of the element, in parent-relative coordinates.
property.description: Setting an element's size or location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: location
property.shortdesc: The upper left corner of this element relative to its parent.
property.description: The location is defined as [bounds.x, bounds.y]. Setting an element's location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: maximumSize
property.shortdesc: The maximum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: minimumSize
property.shortdesc: The minimum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: preferredSize
property.shortdesc: The preferred size, used by layout managers to determine the best size for each element.
property.description: If not explicitly set by a script, value is established by the UI framework in which ScriptUI is employed, and is based on such attributes of the element as its text, font, font size, icon size, and other UI framework-specific attributes.A script can explicitly set this value before the layout manager is invoked in order to establish an element size other than the default.

property.name: size
property.shortdesc: The current dimensions of this element.
property.description: Initially undefined, and unless explicitly set by a script, it is defined by a LayoutManager . A script can explicitly set size before the layout manager is invoked to establish an element size other than the preferredSize or the default size, but this is not recommended. Defined as [bounds.width, bounds.height]. Setting an element's size changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: windowBounds
property.shortdesc: The bounds of this element relative to the top-level parent window.

property.name: active
property.shortdesc: True if this element is active.
property.description: An active control is the one with keyboard focus—that is, the one that accepts keystrokes, or in the case of a Button, is selected when the user types Return or Enter in Windows, or the space bar in Mac OS.

property.name: shortcutKey
property.shortdesc: The key sequence that invokes the onShortcutKey() callback for this element (in Windows only).

property.name: alignment
property.shortdesc: The alignment style for this element. If defined, this value overrides the alignChildren setting for the parent container.
property.description:
This can be a single string, which indicates the alignment for the orientation specified in the parent container, or an array of two strings, indicating both the horizontal and vertical alignment (in that order). Allowed values depend on the orientation value of the parent container. They are not case sensitive.
For orientation=row:top, bottom, fill
For orientation=column: left, right, fill
For orientation=stack:top, bottom, left, right, fill

property.name: children
property.shortdesc: An array of child elements.

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the container (properties used only when the element is created).
property.description:
Creation properties of an EditText object can include:
multiline: When false (the default), the control displays a single line of text. When true, the control displays multiple lines, in which case the text wraps within the width of the control.
readonly: When false (the default), the control accepts text input. When true, the control does not accept input but only displays the contents of the text property.
noecho: When false (the default), the control displays input text. When true, the control does not display input text (used for password input fields).
enterKeySignalsOnChange: When false (the default), the control signals an
onChange event when the editable text is changed and the control loses the keyboard focus (that is, the user tabs to another control, clicks outside the control, or types Enter). When true, the control only signals an onChange() event when the editable text is changed and the user types Enter; other changes to the keyboard focus do not signal the event.
wantReturn: Only applies to multiple line edit controls in ScriptUI Version 6.0 or later. When true the RETURN/ENTER keystroke is considered as text-input advancing the cursor to the next line. The default value is false.

property.name: enabled
property.shortdesc: True if this element is enabled.
property.description: An enabled element can accept input, according to its type. When false, control elements do not accept input, and all types of elements have a dimmed appearance.

property.name: helpTip
property.shortdesc: The help text that is displayed when the mouse hovers over the element.

property.name: indent
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels to indent the element during automatic layout.
property.description: Applies for column orientation and left alignment, or row orientation and top alignment.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The parent element.

property.name: window
property.shortdesc: The window that this element belongs to.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The element type; "edittext".

method.name: show
method.shortdesc: Shows this element.
method.description: When a window or container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but when it is shown again, the children retain their own visibility states.

method.name: hide
method.shortdesc: Hides this element.

method.name: notify
method.shortdesc: Sends a notification message, simulating the specified user interaction event.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the control event handler to call.
parameter.description: One of: onClick, onChange, onChanging. By default, simulates the onChange event for an edittext control, an onClick event for controls that support that event.

method.name: addEventListener
method.shortdesc: Registers an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this element.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the event.
parameter.description: Event names are listed in the JavaScript Tools Guide.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.
parameter.description: This can be the name of a function defined in the extension, or a locally defined handler function to be executed when the event occurs. A handler function takes one argument, the UIEvent object.

parameter.name: capturePhase
parameter.shortdesc: When true, the handler is called only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.
parameter.description: Default is false, meaning that the handler is called in the bubbling phase if this object is an ancestor of the target, or in the at-target phase if this object is itself the target.

method.name: removeEventListener
method.shortdesc: Unregisters an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this element.
method.description: All arguments must be identical to those that were used to register the event handler.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the event.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.

parameter.name: capturePhase
parameter.shortdesc: Whether to call the handler only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.

method.name: dispatchEvent
method.shortdesc: Simulates the occurrence of an event in this target.
method.description: A script can create a UIEvent object for a specific event and pass it to this method to start the event propagation for the event.

method.name: onActivate
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element acquires the keyboard focus.
method.description: Called when the user gives the control the keyboard focus by clicking it or tabbing into it.

method.name: onDeactivate
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element loses the keyboard focus.
method.description: Called when the user moves the keyboard focus from the previously active control to another control.

method.name: onDraw
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the window is about to be drawn.
method.description: Allows the script to modify or control the appearance, using the control’s associated ScriptUIGraphics object. Handler takes one argument, a DrawState object.

method.name: onChanging
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the content of the element is in the process of changing
method.description: The handler is called for each keypress while this control has the input focus.

method.name: onChange
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the content of the element has been changed
method.description:
The handler is called only when the change is complete—that is, when focus moves to another control, or the user types Enter. The exact behavior depends on the creation parameter enterKeySignalsOnChange;see the
properties property.

method.name: onShortcutKey
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element's shortcutKey sequence is typed in the active window.
method.description: In Windows only.

classdef.name: ListBox
classdef.shortdesc: Displays a list of choices, represented by ListItem objects.
classdef.description:
When you create the object, you specify whether it allows the user to select only one or multiple items. If a list contains more items than can be displayed in the available area, a scrollbar may appear that allows the user to scroll through all the list items.
You can specify the items on creation of the list object, or afterward using the list object’s add() method. You can remove items programmatically with the list object’s remove() and removeAll() methods. You can create a list box with multiple columns; in this case, each row is a selectable choice, and each ListItem represents one row.

property.name: items
property.shortdesc: The array of choice items displayed in the list.
property.description: Access this array with a 0-based index. To obtain the number of items in the list, use items.length.The objects are created when items are specified on creation of the parent list object, or afterward using the list control’s add() method. Each item has a selected property that is true when it is in the selected state.

property.name: itemSize
property.shortdesc: The width and height in pixels of each item in the list.
property.description: Used by auto-layout to determine the preferredSize of the list, if not otherwise specified. If not set explicitly, the size of each item is set to match the largest height and width among all items in the list

property.name: selection
property.shortdesc: The currently selected item for a single-selection list, or an array of items for current selection in a multi-selection list.
property.description:
Setting this value causes the selected item to be highlighted and to be scrolled into view if necessary. If no items are selected, the value is null. Set to null to deselect all items. You can set the value using the index of an item or an array of indices, rather than object references. If set to an index value that is out of range, the operation is ignored. When set with index values, the property still returns object references.
If you set the value to an array for a single-selection list, only the first item in the array is selected.
If you set the value to a single item for a multi-selection list, that item is added to the current selection.

property.name: active
property.shortdesc: True if this element is active.
property.description: An active control is the one with keyboard focus—that is, the one that accepts keystrokes, or in the case of a Button, is selected when the user types Return or Enter in Windows, or the space bar in Mac OS.

property.name: shortcutKey
property.shortdesc: The key sequence that invokes the onShortcutKey() callback for this element (in Windows only).

property.name: graphics
property.shortdesc: The graphics object that can be used to customize the element's appearance, in response to the onDraw() event.

property.name: visible
property.shortdesc: True if this element is shown, false if it is hidden.
property.description: When a container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but they retain their own visibility values, and are shown or hidden accordingly when the parent is next shown.

property.name: bounds
property.shortdesc: The boundaries of the element, in parent-relative coordinates.
property.description: Setting an element's size or location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: location
property.shortdesc: The upper left corner of this element relative to its parent.
property.description: The location is defined as [bounds.x, bounds.y]. Setting an element's location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: maximumSize
property.shortdesc: The maximum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: minimumSize
property.shortdesc: The minimum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: preferredSize
property.shortdesc: The preferred size, used by layout managers to determine the best size for each element.
property.description: If not explicitly set by a script, value is established by the UI framework in which ScriptUI is employed, and is based on such attributes of the element as its text, font, font size, icon size, and other UI framework-specific attributes.A script can explicitly set this value before the layout manager is invoked in order to establish an element size other than the default.

property.name: size
property.shortdesc: The current dimensions of this element.
property.description: Initially undefined, and unless explicitly set by a script, it is defined by a LayoutManager . A script can explicitly set size before the layout manager is invoked to establish an element size other than the preferredSize or the default size, but this is not recommended. Defined as [bounds.width, bounds.height]. Setting an element's size changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: windowBounds
property.shortdesc: The bounds of this element relative to the top-level parent window.

property.name: alignment
property.shortdesc: The alignment style for this element. If defined, this value overrides the alignChildren setting for the parent container.
property.description:
This can be a single string, which indicates the alignment for the orientation specified in the parent container, or an array of two strings, indicating both the horizontal and vertical alignment (in that order). Allowed values depend on the orientation value of the parent container. They are not case sensitive.
For orientation=row:top, bottom, fill
For orientation=column: left, right, fill
For orientation=stack:top, bottom, left, right, fill

property.name: children
property.shortdesc: An array of child ListItem elements.

property.name: columns
property.shortdesc: For a multi-column list box, the column properties.
property.description:
A JavaScript object with two read-only properties whose values are set by the creation parameters:
titles: An array of column title strings, whose length matches the number of columns specified at creation.
preferredWidths: An array of column widths, whose length matches the number of columns specified at creation.
visible: An array of boolean visible attributes, whose length matches the number of columns specified at creation.This property can be used to show/hide a column. Avaiblable in ScriptUI Version 6.0 or later provided ScriptUI.frameworkName == 'Flex'.

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the control (properties used only when the element is created).
property.description:
Creation properties of a ListBox object can include:
multiselect: When false (the default), only one item can be selected. When true, multiple items can be selected.
items: An array of strings for the text of each list item. An item object is created for each item. An item with the text string "-" creates a separator item. Supply this property, or the items argument to the add() method, not both. This form is most useful for elements defined using Resource Specifications.
numberOfColumns: A number of columns in which to display the items; default is 1. When there are multiple columns, each ListItem object represents a selectable row. Its text and image values specify the label in the first column, and the subitems property specifies the labels in the additional columns.
showHeaders: True to display column titles.
columnWidths: An array of numbers for the preferred width in pixels of each column.
columnTitles: A corresponding array of strings for the title of each column, to be shown if showHeaders is true.

property.name: enabled
property.shortdesc: True if this element is enabled.
property.description: An enabled element can accept input, according to its type. When false, control elements do not accept input, and all types of elements have a dimmed appearance.

property.name: helpTip
property.shortdesc: The help text that is displayed when the mouse hovers over the element.

property.name: indent
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels to indent the element during automatic layout.
property.description: Applies for column orientation and left alignment, or row orientation and top alignment.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The parent element.

property.name: window
property.shortdesc: The window that this element belongs to.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The element type; "listbox".

method.name: add
method.shortdesc: Adds an item to the choices in this list.
method.description: Returns the item control object. If this is a multi-column list box, each added ListItem represents one selectable row. Its text and image values specify the label in the first column, and the subitems property specifies the labels in the additional columns.

parameter.name: type
parameter.shortdesc: The type of the child element, the string "item".

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The localizable text label for the item.

method.name: find
method.shortdesc: Retrieves an item object from the list that has a given text label.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The text string to match.

method.name: remove
method.shortdesc: Removes a child item from the list.

parameter.name: what
parameter.shortdesc: The item or child to remove, specified by 0-based index, text value, or as a ListItem object.

method.name: removeAll
method.shortdesc: Removes all child items from the list.

method.name: notify
method.shortdesc: Sends a notification message, simulating the specified user interaction event.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the control event handler to call.
parameter.description: One of: onClick, onChange, onChanging. By default, simulates the onChange event for an edittext control, an onClick event for controls that support that event.

method.name: show
method.shortdesc: Shows this element.
method.description: When a window or container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but when it is shown again, the children retain their own visibility states.

method.name: hide
method.shortdesc: Hides this element.

method.name: addEventListener
method.shortdesc: Registers an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this element.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the event.
parameter.description: Event names are listed in the JavaScript Tools Guide.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.
parameter.description: This can be the name of a function defined in the extension, or a locally defined handler function to be executed when the event occurs. A handler function takes one argument, the UIEvent object.

parameter.name: capturePhase
parameter.shortdesc: When true, the handler is called only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.
parameter.description: Default is false, meaning that the handler is called in the bubbling phase if this object is an ancestor of the target, or in the at-target phase if this object is itself the target.

method.name: removeEventListener
method.shortdesc: Unregisters an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this element.
method.description: All arguments must be identical to those that were used to register the event handler.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the event.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.

parameter.name: capturePhase
parameter.shortdesc: Whether to call the handler only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.

method.name: dispatchEvent
method.shortdesc: Simulates the occurrence of an event in this target.
method.description: A script can create a UIEvent object for a specific event and pass it to this method to start the event propagation for the event.

method.name: onActivate
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element acquires the keyboard focus.
method.description: Called when the user gives the control the keyboard focus by clicking it or tabbing into it.

method.name: onDeactivate
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element loses the keyboard focus.
method.description: Called when the user moves the keyboard focus from the previously active control to another control.

method.name: onChange
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the content of the element has been changed

method.name: onDoubleClick
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when an item in the listbox is double-clicked
method.description: Check the selection property to identify the item that was double-clicked.

method.name: onShortcutKey
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element's shortcutKey sequence is typed in the active window.
method.description: In Windows only.

method.name: onDraw
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the window is about to be drawn.
method.description: Allows the script to modify or control the appearance, using the control’s associated ScriptUIGraphics object. Handler takes one argument, a DrawState object.

classdef.name: DropDownList
classdef.shortdesc: Displays a single visible item. When you click the control, a list drops down or pops up, and allows you to select one of the other items in the list.
classdef.description: Drop-down lists can have nonselectable separator items for visually separating groups of related items, as in a menu. You can specify the items on creation of the list object, or afterward using the list object’s add() method. You can remove items programmatically with the list object’s remove() and removeAll() methods. Calls the onChange() callback if the item selection is changed or if its notify() method is called.

property.name: items
property.shortdesc: The array of choice items displayed in the drop-down or pop-up list.
property.description:
Access this array with a 0-based index. To obtain the number of items in the list, use
items.length.The objects are created when items are specified on creation of the parent list object, or afterward using the list control’s add() method. Items in a drop-down list can be of type separator, in which case they cannot be selected, and are shown as a horizontal line. Each item has a selected property that is true when it is in the selected state.

property.name: itemSize
property.shortdesc: The width and height in pixels of each item in the list.
property.description: Used by auto-layout to determine the preferredSize of the list, if not otherwise specified. If not set explicitly, the size of each item is set to match the largest height and width among all items in the list

property.name: selection
property.shortdesc: The currently selected list item.
property.description: Setting this value causes the selected item to be highlighted and to be scrolled into view if necessary. If no items are selected, the value is null. Set to null to deselect all items.You can set the value using the index of an item, rather than an object reference. If set to an index value that is out of range, the operation is ignored. When set with an index value, the property still returns an object reference.

property.name: active
property.shortdesc: True if this element is active.
property.description: An active control is the one with keyboard focus—that is, the one that accepts keystrokes, or in the case of a Button, is selected when the user types Return or Enter in Windows, or the space bar in Mac OS.

property.description: The location is defined as [bounds.x, bounds.y]. Setting an element's location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

Defined as [bounds.width, bounds.height]. Setting an element's size changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.
