property.shortdesc: The bounds of this element relative to the top-level parent window.

property.name: alignment
property.shortdesc: The alignment style for this element. If defined, this value overrides the alignChildren setting for the parent container.
property.description:
This can be a single string, which indicates the alignment for the orientation specified in the parent container, or an array of two strings, indicating both the horizontal and vertical alignment (in that order). Allowed values depend on the orientation value of the parent container. They are not case sensitive.
For orientation=row:top, bottom, fill
For orientation=column: left, right, fill
For orientation=stack:top, bottom, left, right, fill

property.name: children
property.shortdesc: An array of child elements.

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the container (properties used only when the element is created).
property.description:
Creation properties of a DropDownList object can include:
items: An array of strings for the text of each list item. An item object is created for each item. An item with the text string "-" creates a separator item. Supply this property, or the items argument to the add() method, not both. This form is most useful for elements defined using Resource Specifications.

property.name: enabled
property.shortdesc: True if this element is enabled.
property.description: An enabled element can accept input, according to its type. When false, control elements do not accept input, and all types of elements have a dimmed appearance.

property.name: helpTip
property.shortdesc: The help text that is displayed when the mouse hovers over the element.

property.name: indent
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels to indent the element during automatic layout.
property.description: Applies for column orientation and left alignment, or row orientation and top alignment.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The parent element.

property.name: window
property.shortdesc: The window that this element belongs to.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The element type; "dropdownlist".

method.name: add
method.shortdesc: Adds an item or separator to the choices in this list.
method.description: Returns the item control object for type="item", or null for type="separator".

parameter.name: type
parameter.shortdesc: The type of the child element.
parameter.description: Either item (a basic, selectable item with a text label) or separator

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The localizable text label for the item.

method.name: find
method.shortdesc: Retrieves an item object from the list that has a given text label.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The text string to match.

method.name: remove
method.shortdesc: Removes a child item from the list.

parameter.name: what
parameter.shortdesc: The item or child to remove, specified by 0-based index, text value, or as a ListItem object.

method.name: removeAll
method.shortdesc: Removes all child items from the list.

method.name: notify
method.shortdesc: Sends a notification message, simulating the specified user interaction event.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the control event handler to call.
parameter.description: One of: onClick, onChange, onChanging. By default, simulates the onChange event for an edittext control, an onClick event for controls that support that event.

method.name: dispatchEvent
method.shortdesc: Simulates the occurrence of an event in this target.
method.description: A script can create a UIEvent object for a specific event and pass it to this method to start the event propagation for the event.

method.name: onActivate
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element acquires the keyboard focus.
method.description: Called when the user gives the control the keyboard focus by clicking it or tabbing into it.

method.name: onDeactivate
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element loses the keyboard focus.
method.description: Called when the user moves the keyboard focus from the previously active control to another control.

method.name: onChange
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the content of the element has been changed

method.name: onShortcutKey
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element's shortcutKey sequence is typed in the active window.
method.description: In Windows only.

method.name: onDraw
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the window is about to be drawn.
method.description: Allows the script to modify or control the appearance, using the control’s associated ScriptUIGraphics object. Handler takes one argument, a DrawState object.

classdef.name: ListItem
classdef.shortdesc: An item in a list box, drop-down list, or tree view.
classdef.description:
You can specify initial items in the creation parameters when creating the parent list. Create new items using the add() method (ListBox.add(), DropDownList.add(), TreeView.add()) in the parent list with control type="item", or, for DropDownList controls, type="separator".
For a multi-column list box, the object represents one selectable row. Its text and image values specify the label in the first column, and the subitems property specifies the labels in the additional columns.

property.name: checked
property.shortdesc: The checked state of an item in a list.
property.description: When true, the item is marked with the platform-appropriate checkmark. When false, no checkmark is drawn, but space is reserved for it in the left margin, so that the item lines up with other checkable items. When undefined, no space is reserved for a checkmark.

property.name: expanded
property.shortdesc: The expansion state of an item of type node that is a child of a TreeView list control.
property.description: When true, the item is in the expanded state and its children are shown, when false, it is collapsed and children are hidden.

property.name: index
property.shortdesc: The 0-based index of this item in the items collection of its parent list control.

property.name: selected
property.shortdesc: The selection state of this item.
property.description: When true, the item is part of the selection for its parent list. When false, the item is not selected. Set to true to select this item in a single-selection list, or to add it to the selection array for a multi-selection list.

property.name: image
property.shortdesc: An image object for an icon to display in the item.
property.description: When specified, the image appropriate to the selections state is drawn to the left of the text label. If the parent is a multi-column list box, this describes the label in the first column. Labels in additional columns are described by the subitems property.

property.name: text
property.shortdesc: The label text to display for the item, a localizable string.
property.description: If the parent is a multi-column list box, this describes the label in the first column. Labels in additional columns are described by the subitems property.

property.name: subItems
property.shortdesc: When the parent is a multi-column ListBox, this describes the labels for this selectable row in additional columns.
property.description:
A array of JavaScript objects whose length is one less than the number of columns. The first member describes the label in the second column. Each member object has two properties, of which you can specify one or both:
text: A display string for the corresponding label.
image: An ScriptUIImage object for the corresponding label.

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the item (properties used only when the element is created).
property.description: A ListItem object has no creation properties.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The parent element, a list control.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The element type.
property.description: Normally "item", but an item whose parent is a DropDownList control can have type "separator". A separator item is not mouse-sensitive and is drawn as a horizontal line across the drop-down or pop-up menu.

classdef.name: Checkbox
classdef.shortdesc: A dual-state control showing a box that has a checkmark when the value is true, and is empty when the value is false.
classdef.description: Calls the onClick() callback if the control is clicked or if its notify() method is called.

property.name: value
property.shortdesc: The selection state of the control.
property.description: When true, the control is in the selected or set state and displays the check mark. When false, shows an empty box.

property.name: characters
property.shortdesc: A number of characters for which to reserve space when calculating the preferred size of the element.

property.name: justify
property.shortdesc: The default text justification style for child text elements.
property.description: One of left, center, or right. Justification only works if this value is set on creation of the element.

property.name: text
property.shortdesc: The text to display, a localizable string.

property.name: active
property.shortdesc: True if this element is active.
property.description: An active control is the one with keyboard focus—that is, the one that accepts keystrokes, or in the case of a Button, is selected when the user types Return or Enter in Windows, or the space bar in Mac OS.

property.name: shortcutKey
property.shortdesc: The key sequence that invokes the onShortcutKey() callback for this element (in Windows only).

property.name: graphics
property.shortdesc: The graphics object that can be used to customize the element's appearance, in response to the onDraw() event.

property.name: visible
property.shortdesc: True if this element is shown, false if it is hidden.
property.description: When a container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but they retain their own visibility values, and are shown or hidden accordingly when the parent is next shown.

property.name: bounds
property.shortdesc: The boundaries of the element, in parent-relative coordinates.
property.description: Setting an element's size or location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: location
property.shortdesc: The upper left corner of this element relative to its parent.
property.description: The location is defined as [bounds.x, bounds.y]. Setting an element's location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: maximumSize
property.shortdesc: The maximum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: minimumSize
property.shortdesc: The minimum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: preferredSize
property.shortdesc: The preferred size, used by layout managers to determine the best size for each element.
property.description: If not explicitly set by a script, value is established by the UI framework in which ScriptUI is employed, and is based on such attributes of the element as its text, font, font size, icon size, and other UI framework-specific attributes.A script can explicitly set this value before the layout manager is invoked in order to establish an element size other than the default.

property.name: size
property.shortdesc: The current dimensions of this element.
property.description: Initially undefined, and unless explicitly set by a script, it is defined by a LayoutManager . A script can explicitly set size before the layout manager is invoked to establish an element size other than the preferredSize or the default size, but this is not recommended. Defined as [bounds.width, bounds.height]. Setting an element's size changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: windowBounds
property.shortdesc: The bounds of this element relative to the top-level parent window.

property.name: alignment
property.shortdesc: The alignment style for this element. If defined, this value overrides the alignChildren setting for the parent container.
property.description:
This can be a single string, which indicates the alignment for the orientation specified in the parent container, or an array of two strings, indicating both the horizontal and vertical alignment (in that order). Allowed values depend on the orientation value of the parent container. They are not case sensitive.
For orientation=row:top, bottom, fill
For orientation=column: left, right, fill
For orientation=stack:top, bottom, left, right, fill

property.name: children
property.shortdesc: An array of child elements.

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the item (properties used only when the element is created).
property.description: A CheckBox object has no creation properties. The third argument to the add() method that creates it is the text to be displayed.

property.name: enabled
property.shortdesc: True if this element is enabled.
property.description: An enabled element can accept input, according to its type. When false, control elements do not accept input, and all types of elements have a dimmed appearance.

property.name: helpTip
property.shortdesc: The help text that is displayed when the mouse hovers over the element.

property.name: indent
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels to indent the element during automatic layout.
property.description: Applies for column orientation and left alignment, or row orientation and top alignment.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The parent element.

property.name: window
property.shortdesc: The window that this element belongs to.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The element type; "checkbox".

method.name: notify
method.shortdesc: Sends a notification message, simulating the specified user interaction event.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the control event handler to call.
parameter.description: One of: onClick, onChange, onChanging. By default, simulates the onChange event for an edittext control, an onClick event for controls that support that event.

method.name: show
method.shortdesc: Shows this element.
method.description: When a window or container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but when it is shown again, the children retain their own visibility states.

method.name: hide
method.shortdesc: Hides this element.

method.name: addEventListener
method.shortdesc: Registers an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this element.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the event.
parameter.description: Event names are listed in the JavaScript Tools Guide.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.
parameter.description: This can be the name of a function defined in the extension, or a locally defined handler function to be executed when the event occurs. A handler function takes one argument, the UIEvent object.

parameter.name: capturePhase
parameter.shortdesc: When true, the handler is called only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.
parameter.description: Default is false, meaning that the handler is called in the bubbling phase if this object is an ancestor of the target, or in the at-target phase if this object is itself the target.

method.name: removeEventListener
method.shortdesc: Unregisters an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this element.
method.description: All arguments must be identical to those that were used to register the event handler.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the event.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.

parameter.name: capturePhase
parameter.shortdesc: Whether to call the handler only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.

classdef.name: Scrollbar
classdef.shortdesc: A scrollbar with a draggable scroll indicator and stepper buttons to move the indicator.
classdef.description: The scrollbar control has a horizontal orientation if the width is greater than the height at creation time, or vertical if its height is greater than its width. Calls the onChange() callback after the position of the indicator is changed or if its notify() method is called. Calls the onChanging() callback repeatedly while the user is moving the indicator. Scrollbars are often created with an associated EditText field to display the current value of the scrollbar, and to allow setting the scrollbar's position to a specific value.

property.name: stepdelta
property.shortdesc: The amount by which to increment or decrement a scrollbar element's position when the user clicks a stepper button.

property.name: jumpdelta
property.shortdesc: The amount to increment or decrement a scrollbar indicator's position when the user clicks ahead or behind the moveable element.
property.description: Default is 20% of the range between the maxvalue and minvalue property values.

property.name: value
property.shortdesc: The current position of the indicator.
property.description: If set to a value outside the range specified by minvalue and maxvalue, it is automatically reset to the closest boundary.

property.name: minvalue
property.shortdesc: The minimum value allowed in the value property.
property.description: Together with maxvalue, sets the scrolling range.Default is 0.

property.name: maxvalue
property.shortdesc: The maximum value allowed in the value property.
property.description: Together with minvalue, sets the scrolling range. Default is 100.

property.name: active
property.shortdesc: True if this element is active.
property.description: An active control is the one with keyboard focus—that is, the one that accepts keystrokes, or in the case of a Button, is selected when the user types Return or Enter in Windows, or the space bar in Mac OS.

property.name: shortcutKey
property.shortdesc: The key sequence that invokes the onShortcutKey() callback for this element (in Windows only).

property.name: graphics
property.shortdesc: The graphics object that can be used to customize the element's appearance, in response to the onDraw() event.

property.name: visible
property.shortdesc: True if this element is shown, false if it is hidden.
property.description: When a container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but they retain their own visibility values, and are shown or hidden accordingly when the parent is next shown.

property.name: bounds
property.shortdesc: The boundaries of the element, in parent-relative coordinates.
property.description: Setting an element's size or location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: location
property.shortdesc: The upper left corner of this element relative to its parent.
property.description: The location is defined as [bounds.x, bounds.y]. Setting an element's location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: maximumSize
property.shortdesc: The maximum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: minimumSize
property.shortdesc: The minimum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: preferredSize
property.shortdesc: The preferred size, used by layout managers to determine the best size for each element.
property.description: If not explicitly set by a script, value is established by the UI framework in which ScriptUI is employed, and is based on such attributes of the element as its text, font, font size, icon size, and other UI framework-specific attributes.A script can explicitly set this value before the layout manager is invoked in order to establish an element size other than the default.

property.name: size
property.shortdesc: The current dimensions of this element.
property.description: Initially undefined, and unless explicitly set by a script, it is defined by a LayoutManager . A script can explicitly set size before the layout manager is invoked to establish an element size other than the preferredSize or the default size, but this is not recommended. Defined as [bounds.width, bounds.height]. Setting an element's size changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: windowBounds
property.shortdesc: The bounds of this element relative to the top-level parent window.

property.name: alignment
property.shortdesc: The alignment style for this element. If defined, this value overrides the alignChildren setting for the parent container.
property.description:
This can be a single string, which indicates the alignment for the orientation specified in the parent container, or an array of two strings, indicating both the horizontal and vertical alignment (in that order). Allowed values depend on the orientation value of the parent container. They are not case sensitive.
For orientation=row:top, bottom, fill
For orientation=column: left, right, fill
For orientation=stack:top, bottom, left, right, fill

property.name: children
property.shortdesc: An array of child elements.

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the container (properties used only when the element is created).
property.description: A Scrollbar object has no creation properties. The third argument of the add() method that creates it is the initial value, and the fourth and fifth arguments are the minimum and maximum values of the range.

property.name: enabled
property.shortdesc: True if this element is enabled.
property.description: An enabled element can accept input, according to its type. When false, control elements do not accept input, and all types of elements have a dimmed appearance.

property.name: helpTip
property.shortdesc: The help text that is displayed when the mouse hovers over the element.

property.name: indent
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels to indent the element during automatic layout.
property.description: Applies for column orientation and left alignment, or row orientation and top alignment.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The parent element.

property.name: window
property.shortdesc: The window that this element belongs to.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The element type, "scrollbar".

method.description: The handler is called for any motion of the position indicator while this control has the input focus.

classdef.name: RadioButton
classdef.shortdesc: A dual-state control, grouped with other radiobuttons, of which only one can be in the selected state.
classdef.description: Shows the selected state when value=true, empty when value=false. Calls the onClick() callback if the control is clicked or if its notify() method is called.

classdef.name: Slider
classdef.shortdesc: A slider bar that indicates a numeric value with a moveable position indicator.
classdef.description: All slider controls have a horizontal orientation. Calls the onChange() callback after the position of the indicator is changed or if its notify() method is called. Calls the onChanging() callback repeatedly while the user is moving the indicator. The value property contains the current position of the indicator within the range of minvalue to maxvalue.

property.name: value
property.shortdesc: The current position of the indicator.
property.description: If set to a value outside the range specified by minvalue and maxvalue, it is automatically reset to the closest boundary.

property.name: minvalue
property.shortdesc: The minimum value allowed in the value property.
property.description: Together with maxvalue, sets the range.Default is 0.

property.name: maxvalue
property.shortdesc: The maximum value allowed in the value property.
property.description: Together with minvalue, sets the range.Default is 100.

property.name: active
property.shortdesc: True if this element is active.
property.description: An active control is the one with keyboard focus—that is, the one that accepts keystrokes, or in the case of a Button, is selected when the user types Return or Enter in Windows, or the space bar in Mac OS.

property.name: shortcutKey
property.shortdesc: The key sequence that invokes the onShortcutKey() callback for this element (in Windows only).

property.name: graphics
property.shortdesc: The graphics object that can be used to customize the element's appearance, in response to the onDraw() event.

property.name: visible
property.shortdesc: True if this element is shown, false if it is hidden.
property.description: When a container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but they retain their own visibility values, and are shown or hidden accordingly when the parent is next shown.

property.name: bounds
property.shortdesc: The boundaries of the element, in parent-relative coordinates.
property.description: Setting an element's size or location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: location
property.shortdesc: The upper left corner of this element relative to its parent.
property.description: The location is defined as [bounds.x, bounds.y]. Setting an element's location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: maximumSize
property.shortdesc: The maximum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: minimumSize
property.shortdesc: The minimum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: preferredSize
property.shortdesc: The preferred size, used by layout managers to determine the best size for each element.
property.description: If not explicitly set by a script, value is established by the UI framework in which ScriptUI is employed, and is based on such attributes of the element as its text, font, font size, icon size, and other UI framework-specific attributes.A script can explicitly set this value before the layout manager is invoked in order to establish an element size other than the default.

property.name: size
property.shortdesc: The current dimensions of this element.
property.description: Initially undefined, and unless explicitly set by a script, it is defined by a LayoutManager . A script can explicitly set size before the layout manager is invoked to establish an element size other than the preferredSize or the default size, but this is not recommended. Defined as [bounds.width, bounds.height]. Setting an element's size changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: windowBounds
property.shortdesc: The bounds of this element relative to the top-level parent window.

property.name: alignment
property.shortdesc: The alignment style for this element. If defined, this value overrides the alignChildren setting for the parent container.
property.description:
This can be a single string, which indicates the alignment for the orientation specified in the parent container, or an array of two strings, indicating both the horizontal and vertical alignment (in that order). Allowed values depend on the orientation value of the parent container. They are not case sensitive.
For orientation=row:top, bottom, fill
For orientation=column: left, right, fill
For orientation=stack:top, bottom, left, right, fill

property.name: children
property.shortdesc: An array of child elements.

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the container (properties used only when the element is created).
property.description: A Slider object has no creation properties. The third argument of the add() method that creates it is the initial value, and the fourth and fifth arguments are the minimum and maximum values of the range.

property.name: enabled
property.shortdesc: True if this element is enabled.
property.description: An enabled element can accept input, according to its type. When false, control elements do not accept input, and all types of elements have a dimmed appearance.

property.name: helpTip
property.shortdesc: The help text that is displayed when the mouse hovers over the element.

property.name: indent
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels to indent the element during automatic layout.
property.description: Applies for column orientation and left alignment, or row orientation and top alignment.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The parent element.

property.name: window
property.shortdesc: The window that this element belongs to.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The element type, "slider".

method.name: notify
method.shortdesc: Sends a notification message, simulating the specified user interaction event.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the control event handler to call.
parameter.description: One of: onClick, onChange, onChanging. By default, simulates the onChange event for an edittext control, an onClick event for controls that support that event.

method.name: show
method.shortdesc: Shows this element.

method.name: onDeactivate
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element loses the keyboard focus.
method.description: Called when the user moves the keyboard focus from the previously active control to another control.

method.name: onDraw
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the window is about to be drawn.
method.description: Allows the script to modify or control the appearance, using the control’s associated ScriptUIGraphics object. Handler takes one argument, a DrawState object.

method.name: onChanging
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the content of the element is in the process of changing
method.description: The handler is called for any motion of the position indicator while this control has the input focus.

method.name: onChange
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the user has finished dragging the position indicator, or has clicked the control.

method.name: onShortcutKey
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element's shortcutKey sequence is typed in the active window.
method.description: In Windows only.

classdef.name: Progressbar
classdef.shortdesc: A horizontal bar with an indicator that shows the progress of an operation.
classdef.description: All progressbar controls have a horizontal orientation. The value property contains the current position of the progress indicator; the default is 0. There is a minvalue property, but it is always 0; attempts to set it to a different value are silently ignored.

property.name: value
property.shortdesc: The current position of the indicator.
property.description: If set to a value outside the range specified by 0 to maxvalue, it is automatically reset to the closest boundary.

property.name: minvalue
property.shortdesc: The minimum value in the range; always 0. If set to a different value, it is ignored.

property.name: maxvalue
property.shortdesc: The maximum value in the range. Default is 100.

property.name: graphics

classdef.name: TreeView
classdef.shortdesc: A hierarchical list whose items can contain child items.
classdef.description: The ListItem children of this control (in the items array) can be of type node, which means that they can contain child items. An item with child items can expanded, so that the child items are displayed, or collapsed, so that the child items are hidden Individual items can be selected at any level of the tree.

property.name: items
property.shortdesc: The array of top-level items displayed in the list.
property.description: Access this array with a 0-based index. To obtain the number of items in the list, use items.length.The objects are created when items are specified on creation of the parent list object, or afterward using the list control’s add() method.

property.name: itemSize
property.shortdesc: The width and height in pixels of each item in the list.
property.description: Used by auto-layout to determine the preferredSize of the list, if not otherwise specified. If not set explicitly, the size of each item is set to match the largest height and width among all items in the list

property.name: selection
property.shortdesc: The currently selected list item.
property.description: Setting this value causes the selected item to be highlighted and to be scrolled into view if necessary. If no items are selected, the value is null. Set to null to deselect all items.You can set the value using the index of an item, rather than an object reference. If set to an index value that is out of range, the operation is ignored. When set with an index value, the property still returns an object reference.

property.name: active
property.shortdesc: True if this element is active.
property.description: An active control is the one with keyboard focus—that is, the one that accepts keystrokes, or in the case of a Button, is selected when the user types Return or Enter in Windows, or the space bar in Mac OS.

property.name: shortcutKey
property.shortdesc: The key sequence that invokes the onShortcutKey() callback for this element (in Windows only).

property.shortdesc: The graphics object that can be used to customize the element's appearance, in response to the onDraw() event.

property.shortdesc: An array of child elements.

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the control (properties used only when the element is created).
property.description:
Creation properties of a ListBox object can include:
items: An array of strings for the text of each top-level list item. An item object is created for each item. An item with the text string "-" creates a separator item. Supply this property, or the items argument to the add() method, not both. This form is most useful for elements defined using Resource Specifications.

method.name: add
method.shortdesc: Adds an item to the top-level choices in this list.
method.description: Returns the item control object.

parameter.name: type
parameter.shortdesc: The type of the child element, the string "item".

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The localizable text label for the item.

method.name: find
method.shortdesc: Retrieves an item object from the list that has a given text label.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The text string to match.

method.name: remove
method.shortdesc: Removes a child item from the list.

parameter.name: what
parameter.shortdesc: The item or child to remove, specified by 0-based index in the top-level item list, text value, or as a ListItem object.

method.name: removeAll
method.shortdesc: Removes all child items from the list.

classdef.name: FlashPlayer
classdef.shortdesc: A control that contains a Flash Player, which can load and play Flash movies stored in SWF files.
classdef.description: The ScriptUI FlashPlayer element runs the Flash application within an Adobe application. The Flash application runs ActionScript, a different implementation of JavaScript from the ExtendScript version of JavaScript that Adobe applications run. A control object of this type contains functions that allow your script to load SWF files, control movie playback, and communicate with the ActionScript environment.

property.name: active
property.shortdesc: True if this element is active.
property.description: An active control is the one with keyboard focus—that is, the one that accepts keystrokes, or in the case of a Button, is selected when the user types Return or Enter in Windows, or the space bar in Mac OS.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The element type, "flashplayer".

method.name: invokePlayerFunction
method.shortdesc: Invokes an ActionScript function defined in the Flash application.
method.description: Returns the result of the invoked function, which must be one of the allowed types. The ActionScript class and date objects are not supported as return values.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The name of a Flash ActionScript function that has been registered with the ExternalInterface object by the currently loaded SWF file.

parameter.name: argument
parameter.shortdesc: An argument to pass through to the function.
parameter.description: There can be any number of arguments. An argument must be one of these data types:Number, String, Boolean, null, undefined, Object, Array. No other data types are supported.

method.name: loadMovie
method.shortdesc: Loads a movie into the Flash Player, and begins playing it.

parameter.name: file
parameter.shortdesc: The File object for the SWF file to load.

method.name: playMovie
method.shortdesc: Restarts a movie that has been stopped.
method.description:
Do not use on a movie that is currently playing.
The stopMovie()-playMovie() sequence does not work for SWF files produced by Flex, or for some files produced by Flash Authoring (depending on how they were implemented).

parameter.name: rewind
parameter.shortdesc: When true, restarts the movie from the beginning; otherwise, starts playing from the point where it was stopped.

method.name: stopMovie
method.shortdesc: Halts playback of the current movie.
method.description:
The stopMovie()-playMovie() sequence does not work for SWF files produced by Flex, or for some files produced by Flash Authoring (depending on how they were implemented).
Using stopMovie() from the player's hosting environment has no effect on an SWF file playing in a ScriptUI Flash Player element. It is, however, possible to produce an SWF using Flash Authoring that can stop itself in response to user interaction.

method.name: notify
method.shortdesc: Sends a notification message, simulating the specified user interaction event.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the control event handler to call.
parameter.description: One of: onClick, onChange, onChanging. By default, simulates the onChange event for an edittext control, an onClick event for controls that support that event.

parameter.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.
parameter.description: This can be the name of a function defined in the extension, or a locally defined handler function to be executed when the event occurs. A handler function takes one argument, the UIEvent object.

parameter.name: capturePhase
parameter.shortdesc: When true, the handler is called only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.
parameter.description: Default is false, meaning that the handler is called in the bubbling phase if this object is an ancestor of the target, or in the at-target phase if this object is itself the target.

method.name: removeEventListener
method.shortdesc: Unregisters an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this element.
method.description: All arguments must be identical to those that were used to register the event handler.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the event.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.

parameter.name: capturePhase
parameter.shortdesc: Whether to call the handler only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.

method.name: dispatchEvent
method.shortdesc: Simulates the occurrence of an event in this target.
method.description: A script can create a UIEvent object for a specific event and pass it to this method to start the event propagation for the event.

method.name: callback
method.shortdesc: A function definition for a callback from the Flash ActionScript environment.
method.description: The Flash ActionScript code can call any callback function defined on the ExtendScript side of the FlashPlayer object, invoking it by name as a property of the control object. The function can take any arguments of a supported data types, and can return any value of a supported data type. data types:Number, String, Boolean, null, undefined, Object, Array.

classdef.name: Group
classdef.shortdesc: A container for other controls within a window.
classdef.description: A group can specify layout options for its child elements. Hiding a group hides all its children. Making it visible makes visible those children that are not individually hidden.

property.name: graphics
property.shortdesc: The graphics object that can be used to customize the element's appearance, in response to the onDraw() event.

property.name: visible
property.shortdesc: True if this element is shown, false if it is hidden.
property.description: When a container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but they retain their own visibility values, and are shown or hidden accordingly when the parent is next shown.

property.name: bounds
property.shortdesc: The boundaries of the element, in parent-relative coordinates.
property.description: Setting an element's size or location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: location
property.shortdesc: The upper left corner of this element relative to its parent.
property.description: The location is defined as [bounds.x, bounds.y]. Setting an element's location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: maximumSize
property.shortdesc: The maximum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: minimumSize
property.shortdesc: The minimum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: preferredSize
property.shortdesc: The preferred size, used by layout managers to determine the best size for each element.
property.description: If not explicitly set by a script, value is established by the UI framework in which ScriptUI is employed, and is based on such attributes of the element as its text, font, font size, icon size, and other UI framework-specific attributes.A script can explicitly set this value before the layout manager is invoked in order to establish an element size other than the default.

property.name: size
property.shortdesc: The current dimensions of this element.
property.description: Initially undefined, and unless explicitly set by a script, it is defined by a LayoutManager . A script can explicitly set size before the layout manager is invoked to establish an element size other than the preferredSize or the default size, but this is not recommended. Defined as [bounds.width, bounds.height]. Setting an element's size changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: windowBounds
property.shortdesc: The bounds of this element relative to the top-level parent window.

property.name: alignChildren
property.shortdesc: Tells the layout manager how unlike-sized children of this container should be aligned within a column or row.
property.description: Order of creation determines which children are at the top of a column or the left of a row; the earlier a child is created, the closer it is to the top or left of its column or row. If defined, alignment for a child element overrides the alignChildren setting for the parent container. See alignment property for values.

property.name: children
property.shortdesc: An array of child elements.

property.name: layout
property.shortdesc: The layout manager for this container.
property.description: The first time a container object is made visible, ScriptUI invokes this layout manager by calling its layout() function. Default is an instance of the LayoutManager class that is automatically created when the container element is created.

property.name: margins
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels between the edges of a container and the outermost child elements.
property.description: You can specify different margins for each edge of the container. The default value is based on the type of container, and is chosen to match the standard Adobe UI guidelines.

property.name: orientation
property.shortdesc: The layout orientation of children in a container.
property.description: Interpreted by the layout manager for the container. The default LayoutManager Object accepts the (case-insensitive) values row, column, or stack. For window and panel, the default is column, and for group the default is row. The allowed values for the container’s alignChildren and its children’s alignment properties depend on the orientation.

property.name: spacing
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels separating one child element from its adjacent sibling element.
property.description: Because each container holds only a single row or column of children, only a single spacing value is needed for a container. The default value is based on the type of container, and is chosen to match standard Adobe UI guidelines.

property.name: alignment
property.shortdesc: The alignment style for this element. If defined, this value overrides the alignChildren setting for the parent container.
property.description:
This can be a single string, which indicates the alignment for the orientation specified in the parent container, or an array of two strings, indicating both the horizontal and vertical alignment (in that order). Allowed values depend on the orientation value of the parent container. They are not case sensitive.
For orientation=row:top, bottom, fill
For orientation=column: left, right, fill
For orientation=stack:top, bottom, left, right, fill

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the control (properties used only when the element is created).
property.description: A Group object has no creation properties.

property.name: enabled
property.shortdesc: True if this element is enabled.
property.description: An enabled element can accept input, according to its type. When false, control elements do not accept input, and all types of elements have a dimmed appearance.

property.name: helpTip
property.shortdesc: The help text that is displayed when the mouse hovers over the element.

property.name: indent
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels to indent the element during automatic layout.
property.description: Applies for column orientation and left alignment, or row orientation and top alignment.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The parent element.

property.name: window
property.shortdesc: The window that this element belongs to.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The element type; "group".

method.name: show
method.shortdesc: Shows this element.
method.description: When a window or container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but when it is shown again, the children retain their own visibility states.

method.name: hide
method.shortdesc: Hides this element.

method.name: add
method.shortdesc: Adds a child element to this container.
method.description: Creates and returns a new control or container object and adds it to the children of this group.

parameter.name: type
parameter.shortdesc: The type of the child element, as specified for the type property.
parameter.description: Control types are listed in the JavaScript Tools Guide.

parameter.name: bounds
parameter.shortdesc: A bounds specification that describes the size and position of the new control or container, relative to its parent.
parameter.description: If supplied, this value creates a new Bounds object which is assigned to the new object’s bounds property.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The text or label, a localizable string.
parameter.description: Initial text to be displayed in the control as the title, label, or contents, depending on the control type. If supplied, this value is assigned to the new object’s text property.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the new child (properties used only when the element is created).
parameter.description:
The creation properties depend on the element type. See
properties property of each control type.

method.name: remove
method.shortdesc: Removes the specified child control from this group's children array.
method.description: No error results if the child does not exist.

parameter.name: what
parameter.shortdesc: The child control to remove, specified by 0-based index, text property value, or as a control object.

method.name: addEventListener
method.shortdesc: Registers an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this element.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the event.
parameter.description: Event names are listed in the JavaScript Tools Guide.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.
parameter.description: This can be the name of a function defined in the extension, or a locally defined handler function to be executed when the event occurs. A handler function takes one argument, the UIEvent object.

parameter.name: capturePhase
parameter.shortdesc: When true, the handler is called only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.
parameter.description: Default is false, meaning that the handler is called in the bubbling phase if this object is an ancestor of the target, or in the at-target phase if this object is itself the target.

method.name: removeEventListener
method.shortdesc: Unregisters an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this element.
method.description: All arguments must be identical to those that were used to register the event handler.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the event.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.

parameter.name: capturePhase
parameter.shortdesc: Whether to call the handler only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.

method.name: dispatchEvent
method.shortdesc: Simulates the occurrence of an event in this target.
method.description: A script can create a UIEvent object for a specific event and pass it to this method to start the event propagation for the event.

method.name: onDraw
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the group is about to be drawn.
method.description: Allows the script to modify or control the appearance, using the control’s associated ScriptUIGraphics object. Handler takes one argument, a DrawState object.

classdef.name: Panel
classdef.shortdesc: A container for other types of controls, with an optional frame.
classdef.description: A panel can specify layout options for its child elements. Hiding a panel hides all its children. Making it visible makes visible those children that are not individually hidden.

property.name: characters
property.shortdesc: Reserve space for the specified number of characters; affects calculation of preferredSize .

property.name: justify
property.shortdesc: The default text justification style for child text elements.
property.description: One of left, center, or right. Justification only works if this value is set on creation of the element.

property.name: text
property.shortdesc: The title or label text, a localizable string.

property.name: graphics
property.shortdesc: The graphics object that can be used to customize the element's appearance, in response to the onDraw() event.

property.name: visible
property.shortdesc: True if this element is shown, false if it is hidden.
property.description: When a container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but they retain their own visibility values, and are shown or hidden accordingly when the parent is next shown.

property.name: bounds
property.shortdesc: The boundaries of the element, in parent-relative coordinates.
property.description: Setting an element's size or location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: location
property.shortdesc: The upper left corner of this element's frame relative to its parent.
property.description: The location is defined as [bounds.x, bounds.y]. Setting an element's location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: maximumSize
property.shortdesc: The maximum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: minimumSize
property.shortdesc: The minimum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: preferredSize
property.shortdesc: The preferred size, used by layout managers to determine the best size for each element.
property.description: If not explicitly set by a script, value is established by the UI framework in which ScriptUI is employed, and is based on such attributes of the element as its text, font, font size, icon size, and other UI framework-specific attributes.A script can explicitly set this value before the layout manager is invoked in order to establish an element size other than the default.

property.name: size
property.shortdesc: The current dimensions of this element.
property.description: Initially undefined, and unless explicitly set by a script, it is defined by a LayoutManager . A script can explicitly set size before the layout manager is invoked to establish an element size other than the preferredSize or the default size, but this is not recommended. Defined as [bounds.width, bounds.height]. Setting an element's size changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: windowBounds
property.shortdesc: The bounds of this element relative to the top-level parent window.

property.name: alignChildren
property.shortdesc: Specifies how to align the child elements.

property.name: children
property.shortdesc: An array of child elements.

property.name: layout
property.shortdesc: The layout manager for this container.
property.description: The first time a container object is made visible, ScriptUI invokes this layout manager by calling its layout() function. Default is an instance of the LayoutManager class that is automatically created when the container element is created.

property.name: margins
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels between the edges of a container and the outermost child elements.
property.description: You can specify different margins for each edge of the container. The default value is based on the type of container, and is chosen to match the standard Adobe UI guidelines.

property.name: orientation
property.shortdesc: The layout orientation of children in a container.
property.description: Interpreted by the layout manager for the container. The default LayoutManager Object accepts the (case-insensitive) values row, column, or stack. For window and panel, the default is column, and for group the default is row. The allowed values for the container’s alignChildren and its children’s alignment properties depend on the orientation.

property.name: spacing
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels separating one child element from its adjacent sibling element.
property.description: Because each container holds only a single row or column of children, only a single spacing value is needed for a container. The default value is based on the type of container, and is chosen to match standard Adobe UI guidelines.

property.name: alignment
property.shortdesc: The alignment style for this element. If defined, this value overrides the alignChildren setting for the parent container.
property.description:
This can be a single string, which indicates the alignment for the orientation specified in the parent container, or an array of two strings, indicating both the horizontal and vertical alignment (in that order). Allowed values depend on the orientation value of the parent container. They are not case sensitive.
For orientation=row:top, bottom, fill
For orientation=column: left, right, fill
For orientation=stack:top, bottom, left, right, fill

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the control (properties used only when the element is created).
property.description:
Creation properties of a Panel object can include:
borderStyle: A string that specifies the appearance of the border drawn around the panel. One of black, etched, gray, raised, sunken. Default is etched.
su1PanelCoordinates: Photoshop only. When true, this panel automatically adjusts the positions of its children for compatability with Photoshop CS. Default is false, meaning that the panel does not adjust the positions of its children, even if the parent window has automatic adjustment enabled.

property.name: enabled
property.shortdesc: True if this element is enabled.
property.description: An enabled element can accept input, according to its type. When false, control elements do not accept input, and all types of elements have a dimmed appearance.

property.name: helpTip
property.shortdesc: The help text that is displayed when the mouse hovers over the element.

property.name: indent
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels to indent the element during automatic layout.
property.description: Applies for column orientation and left alignment, or row orientation and top alignment.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The parent element.

property.name: window
property.shortdesc: The window that this element belongs to.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The element type; "panel".

method.name: show
method.shortdesc: Shows this element.
method.description: When a window or container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but when it is shown again, the children retain their own visibility states.

method.name: hide
method.shortdesc: Hides this element.

method.name: add
method.shortdesc: Adds a child element to this container.
method.description: Creates and returns a new control or container object and adds it to the children of this group.

parameter.name: type
parameter.shortdesc: The type of the child element, as specified for the type property.
parameter.description: Control types are listed in the JavaScript Tools Guide.

parameter.name: bounds
parameter.shortdesc: A bounds specification that describes the size and position of the new control or container, relative to its parent.
parameter.description: If supplied, this value creates a new Bounds object which is assigned to the new object’s bounds property.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The text or label, a localizable string.
parameter.description: Initial text to be displayed in the control as the title, label, or contents, depending on the control type. If supplied, this value is assigned to the new object’s text property.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the new child (properties used only when the element is created).
parameter.description:
The creation properties depend on the element type. See
properties property of each control type.

method.name: remove
method.shortdesc: Removes the specified child control from this group's children array.
method.description: No error results if the child does not exist.

parameter.name: what
parameter.shortdesc: The child control to remove, specified by 0-based index, text property value, or as a control object.

method.name: addEventListener
method.shortdesc: Registers an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this element.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the event.
parameter.description: Event names are listed in the JavaScript Tools Guide.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.
parameter.description: This can be the name of a function defined in the extension, or a locally defined handler function to be executed when the event occurs. A handler function takes one argument, the UIEvent object.

parameter.name: capturePhase
parameter.shortdesc: When true, the handler is called only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.
parameter.description: Default is false, meaning that the handler is called in the bubbling phase if this object is an ancestor of the target, or in the at-target phase if this object is itself the target.

method.name: removeEventListener
method.shortdesc: Unregisters an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this element.
method.description: All arguments must be identical to those that were used to register the event handler.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the event.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.

parameter.name: capturePhase
parameter.shortdesc: Whether to call the handler only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.

method.name: dispatchEvent
method.shortdesc: Simulates the occurrence of an event in this target.
method.description: A script can create a UIEvent object for a specific event and pass it to this method to start the event propagation for the event.

method.name: onDraw
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the panel is about to be drawn.
method.description: Allows the script to modify or control the appearance, using the control’s associated ScriptUIGraphics object. Handler takes one argument, a DrawState object.

classdef.name: Point
classdef.shortdesc: Defines the location of a window or UI element. Contains a 2-element array.
classdef.description: Specifies the origin point of an element as horizontal and vertical pixel offsets from the origin of the element's coordinate space. A Point object is created when you set an element’s location property. You can set the property using a JavaScript object with properties named x and y, or an array with 2 values in the order [x, y].

property.name: x
property.shortdesc: The horizontal coordinate, a pixel offset from the origin of the element's coordinate space.

property.name: y
property.shortdesc: The vertical coordinate, a pixel offset from the origin of the element's coordinate space.

property.name: left
property.shortdesc: The left coordinate.

property.name: top
property.shortdesc: The top coordinate.

property.name: length
property.shortdesc: The array length.

classdef.name: Dimension
classdef.shortdesc: Defines the size of a window or UI element. Contains a 2-element array.
classdef.description: Specifies the height and width of an element in pixels. A Dimension object is created when you set an element’s size property. You can set the property using a JavaScript object with named properties {width: wd, height: ht}, or an array with 2 values in the order [wd, ht].

property.name: width
property.shortdesc: The width in pixels.

property.name: height
property.shortdesc: The height in pixels.

property.name: length
property.shortdesc: The array length.

classdef.name: Bounds
classdef.shortdesc: Defines the boundaries of a window within the screen’s coordinate space, or of a UI element within the container’s coordinate space.
classdef.description: A Bounds object is created when you set an element’s bounds property. You can set the property using a JavaScript object with properties named left, top, right, bottom or x, y, width, height, or an array with 4 values in the order [x, y, wd, ht].

property.name: x
property.shortdesc: The horizontal coordinate, a pixel offset from the origin of the element's coordinate space.

property.name: y
property.shortdesc: The vertical coordinate, a pixel offset from the origin of the element's coordinate space.

property.name: width
property.shortdesc: The width in pixels.

property.name: height
property.shortdesc: The height in pixels.

property.name: left
property.shortdesc: The horizontal coordinate, a pixel offset from the origin of the element's coordinate space.

property.name: right
property.shortdesc: The width in pixels.

property.name: top
property.shortdesc: The height in pixels.

property.name: bottom
property.shortdesc: The vertical coordinate, a pixel offset from the origin of the element's coordinate space.

property.name: length
property.shortdesc: The array length.

classdef.name: UIEvent
classdef.shortdesc: Encapsulates input event information for an event that propagates through a container and control hierarchy.
classdef.description: Implements W3C standard event handling. This object is passed to a function that you register to respond to events of a certain type that occur in a window or control. Use windowObj.addEventListener() or controlObj.addEventListener() to register a handler function.

method.name: UIEvent
method.shortdesc: Creates an event.
method.description: The UIEvent object is normally created by ScriptUI and passed to your event handler. However, you can simulate a user action by constructing an event object and sending it to a target object’s dispatchEvent() function.

parameter.name: type
parameter.shortdesc: The event type. See UIEvent.type property.

parameter.name: captures
parameter.shortdesc: Set to true if this event can be captured.

parameter.name: bubbles
parameter.shortdesc: Set to true if the event bubbles.

parameter.name: view
parameter.shortdesc: The ScriptUI element that this event relates to.

parameter.name: detail
parameter.shortdesc: The click count for a mouse-click event.

property.name: captures
property.shortdesc: True if this event can be captured.

property.name: bubbles
property.shortdesc: True if the event is of a type that bubbles.

property.name: cancelable
property.shortdesc: True if the default action associated with the event can be canceled with preventDefault().

property.name: currentTarget
property.shortdesc: The event target object which is currently handling the event. During capturing and bubbling, this is different from the property target.

property.name: eventPhase
property.shortdesc: The current phase of event propagation; one of none, target, capture, bubble.

property.name: target
property.shortdesc: The event target object for this event.

property.name: timeStamp
property.shortdesc: The date and time at which the event occurred.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The name of the event that this object represents.
property.description: Event types are listed in the JavaScript Tools Guide.

property.name: view
property.shortdesc: The ScriptUI element that this event relates to.

property.name: detail
property.shortdesc: The click count for a mouse-click event.

method.name: preventDefault
method.shortdesc: Prevents the default action associated with this event from being called.

method.name: stopPropagation
method.shortdesc: Stops the propagation of this event.

method.name: initEvent
method.shortdesc: Initializes a UI event as a core W3C event.

parameter.name: type
parameter.shortdesc: The event type.

parameter.name: captures
parameter.shortdesc: Set to true if this event can be captured.

parameter.name: bubbles
parameter.shortdesc: Set to true if the event bubbles.

parameter.name: cancelable
parameter.shortdesc: Set to true if the default action is cancelable.

method.name: initUIEvent
method.shortdesc: Initializes an event.

parameter.name: type
parameter.shortdesc: The event type.

parameter.name: captures
parameter.shortdesc: Set to true if this event can be captured.

parameter.name: bubbles
parameter.shortdesc: Set to true if the event bubbles.

parameter.name: view
parameter.shortdesc: The ScriptUI element that this event relates to.

parameter.name: detail
parameter.shortdesc: The click count for a mouse-click event.

classdef.name: Event
classdef.shortdesc: Base class for UIEvent.
classdef.description: Encapsulates input event information for an event that propagates through a container and control hierarchy. Implements W3C standard event handling.

property.name: captures
property.shortdesc: True if this event can be captured.

property.name: bubbles
property.shortdesc: True if the event is of a type that bubbles.

property.name: cancelable
property.shortdesc: True if the default action associated with the event can be canceled with preventDefault().

property.name: currentTarget
property.shortdesc: The event target object which is currently handling the event. During capturing and bubbling, this is different from the property target.

property.name: eventPhase
property.shortdesc: The current phase of event propagation; one of none, target, capture, bubble.

property.name: target
property.shortdesc: The event target object for this event.

property.name: timeStamp
property.shortdesc: The date and time at which the event occurred.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The name of the event that this object represents.
property.description: Event types are listed in the JavaScript Tools Guide.

method.name: preventDefault
method.shortdesc: Prevents the default action associated with this event from being called.

method.name: stopPropagation
method.shortdesc: Stops the propagation of this event.

classdef.name: Environment
classdef.shortdesc: Defines attributes of the ScriptUI environment.
classdef.description: Access through the ScriptUI.environment property.

property.name: keyboardState
property.shortdesc: An object that reports the active state of the keyboard at any time.
property.description: Provides access to the key state independent of the event-handling framework.

classdef.name: Events
classdef.shortdesc: Provides access to objects used in the ScriptUI event system.
classdef.description: Access through the ScriptUI.events property.

method.name: createEvent
method.shortdesc: Creates an instance of the specified Event subclass.
method.description: The Event returned is a UIEvent, KeyboardEvent or MouseEvent object, depending on the requested type. This object can be passed as a parameter to an element's dispatchEvent function in order to simulate a user-interaction event.

parameter.name: eventType
parameter.shortdesc: The name of an event type: one of "UIEvent", "KeyboardEvent", or "MouseEvent".

classdef.name: KeyboardState
classdef.shortdesc: Reports the active state of the keyboard.
classdef.description: Access through the ScriptUI.environment.keyboardState property. Query the properties of this object at any time to determine the current key that is down and any modifiers that are pressed.

property.name: keyName
property.shortdesc: A string containing the name of the currently pressed key, such as "a", or an empty string.

property.name: shiftKey
property.shortdesc: True if the Shift key is pressed.

property.name: ctrlKey
property.shortdesc: True if the Ctrl key is pressed.

property.name: altKey
property.shortdesc: True if the Alt or Option key is pressed.

property.name: metaKey
property.shortdesc: True if the Cmd key (in Mac OS) or Windows key (in Windows) is pressed.
